definition: to view death as a return home/to not be afraid of dying/to face death with equanimity (idiom)
variant of 視|视[shi4]/variant of 示[shi4]

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor

sentences.english: Several captured commandos death, resolutely refused to disclose on the line.
sentences.chinese: 几个被俘的特战队员视死如归，坚决不肯透露上线。

definition: heroically sacrificing one's life (idiom); to sacrifice oneself fervently to the cause
devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
to give up life for righteousness (idiom, from Mencius); to choose honor over life/would rather sacrifice one's life than one's principles
bravery with no thought of personal safety (idiom); risking life and limb/undaunted by perils

pinyin: bu4 cheng2 gong1 bian4 cheng2 ren2

definition: Better broken jade than intact tile./Death is preferable to dishonor. (idiom)
pinyin: ning4 wei2 yu4 sui4 , bu4 wei2 wa3 quan2
